intro: Cyrtandra subsphaerocarpa, commonly known as the Hawaiian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its erect, woody stems and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical areas.
